Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a pale-red pottery jar, the fabric is grey/brown in section, the interior is slightly grooved, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and very faint traces of a number of black-painted hieratic characters perpendicular to the rilling marks.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393489) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393489)
